info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 6:41PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Bladen and north central Columbus Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 640 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms over Elkton, or 10 miles north of Whiteville, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Whiteville, Bladenboro, Carvers, Abbottsburg, Lisbon, Elkton, Emerson and Clarkton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for southeastern North Carolina.
